com.gridgraph.storage.heap.heapfile.schema

Class SchemaHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gridgraph.storage.heap.heapfile.schema.SchemaHeap
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SchemaDataHeap, SchemaPropertiesHeap

    public abstract class SchemaHeap
extends Object
    An abstract representation of heap file for a schema. Instances of this class supports both creating, reading, writing and deleting data to a heap file stored on file system.
    Author:
    guobao.chen

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      protected StorageManager storageManager 
      protected String version

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes resources for heap file and buffer access
      MappedByteBuffer createBuffer(long basePosition)
      Creates a MappedByteBuffer by specifying start position of the buffer inside underlying file
      HeapDataTuple createTuple(long externalId, Object data)
      Creates a new HeapDataTuple instance and saves it to heap by specifying its external id and an object, usually an upper layer object like a vertex, edge or its property, which contains all needed data for the tuple to be created.
      HeapDataTuple deleteTuple(long externalId)
      Deletes a HeapDataTuple instance permanently from heap file by specifying its external id.
      void drop()
      Closes and drops resources for heap file and buffer access
      String getFileName()
      Returns the schema heap file name
      abstract long getFileSize()
      Returns heap file size
      GraphHeapSpace getGraphHeapSpace()
      Returns graph heap space which maintains all heap data for current graph
      Integer getGraphId()
      Returns id of graph, which is used internally to uniquely identifying a graph instance
      String getGraphName()
      Returns name of graph
      abstract HeapType getHeapType()
      Returns heap file type
      RandomAccessFile getRandomAccessFile()
      Returns the RandomAccessFile instance
      short getSchemaId()
      Returns id of schema
      Integer getSubTypeId() 
      void open()
      Opens the underlying file as a heap data file from file system to read from and/or writes to
      HeapDataTuple readTuple(long externalId)
      Reads and gets a HeapDataTuple instance from heap file by specifying its external id.
      void setGraphHeapSpace(GraphHeapSpace graphHeapSpace)
      Sets graph heap space to maintain heap data for current graph
      void setGraphId(Integer graphId)
      Sets id of graph, which is used internally to uniquely identifying a graph instance
      void setSchemaId(short schemaId)
      Sets id of schema
      void sync()
      Synchronizes any changes to current heap file to be written to physical storage device
      abstract boolean updateNumOfPagesIfNeeded(long numOfPages)
      Updates the number of pages if the specified new value indicates more pages than the existing number
      HeapDataTuple updateTuple(long externalId, Object data)
      Updates an existing HeapDataTuple instance and saves it to heap by specifying its external id and an object, usually an upper layer object like a vertex, edge or its property, which contains all needed data for the tuple to be updated.

                              throws IOException
        Creates a MappedByteBuffer by specifying start position of the buffer inside underlying file

        Returns:
        MappedByteBuffer instance represents a block of mapped memory data for file data
        Throws:

      • createTuple

        public HeapDataTuple createTuple(long externalId,
                                 Object data)
        Creates a new HeapDataTuple instance and saves it to heap by specifying its external id and an object, usually an upper layer object like a vertex, edge or its property, which contains all needed data for the tuple to be created.
        Parameters:
        externalId - external id of data and tuple to be created
        data - object containing data of tuples to be created
        Returns:
        created HeapDataTuple instance

      • updateTuple

        public HeapDataTuple updateTuple(long externalId,
                                 Object data)
        Updates an existing HeapDataTuple instance and saves it to heap by specifying its external id and an object, usually an upper layer object like a vertex, edge or its property, which contains all needed data for the tuple to be updated.
        Parameters:
        externalId - external id of data and tuple to be updated
        data - object containing data of tuples to be updated
        Returns:
        updated HeapDataTuple instance

        Returns:
        read HeapDataTuple instance

        deleted HeapDataTuple instance
